title: Provides Data Pipelining Functions
text: goal islet help establish secure data pipelines data cleaning analytics, designed teams analyzing patient outcome data. Islet, can easily clean process sensitive patient data, generating reports track data irregularities issues.

title: Provides Data Pipelining Functions
text: can install development version islet GitHub :

title: Provides Data Pipelining Functions
text: basic example shows solve common problem: ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . also use GitHub Actions re-render README.Rmd every time push. example workflow can found : https://github.com/r-lib/actions/tree/v1/examples. can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(islet) # Simple Example, Default '&' Border islet::make_banner(str_to_banner = 'analyze column from dataframe') #> #&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&& #> #&&  analyze column from dataframe  && #> #&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&& # Output Saved to Clipboard, Can Cmd+v or Ctrl+v to directly paste banner # New Banner Border Example islet::make_banner(str_to_banner = 'analyze column from dataframe',                    banner_chr = '+') #> #+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ #> #++  analyze column from dataframe  ++ #> #+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

text: windows_path Windows path converted Mac path mounted_drive_name Mounted drive included path

title: Title — from_win_to_mac
Title — from_win_to_mac
code: if (FALSE) { # Convert a Windows path to a Mac path with a mounted drive name of "mydrive" from_win_to_mac("C:\\Users\\myname\\Documents\\myfile.txt", "mydrive")  # Convert a Windows path to a Mac path with a mounted drive name of "Documents" from_win_to_mac("C:\\Users\\myname\\Documents\\myfile.txt", "Documents") }

what: Create a Banner for Code Separation and Organization — make_banner
title: Create a Banner for Code Separation and Organization — make_banner
text: function generates text banner separating organizing code. banner also copied clipboard easy pasting.

title: Create a Banner for Code Separation and Organization — make_banner
Create a Banner for Code Separation and Organization — make_banner
text: str_to_banner string displayed center banner. banner_chr character used creating banner boundary. Default '&'. output boolean indicating whether print banner console. Default TRUE.

title: Create a Banner for Code Separation and Organization — make_banner
Create a Banner for Code Separation and Organization — make_banner
code: if (FALSE) { make_banner(str_to_banner = 'Section Title', banner_chr = '&', output = TRUE) }

code: if (FALSE) { # Path to the SQL file filepath <- system.file("extdata", "my_sql_file.sql", package = "my_package")  # Call the function to read the SQL file and format it into a query to_sql_query(filepath) }
